tuv.seg: Circumstantial evidence is evidence of facts from which inferences or can be drawn
Tugtar fianaise imthoisceach ar fhianaise a bhaineann le fíricí gur féidir conclúidí nó tuairimí a bhaint astu
For example, in an assault case where the crime took place on O'Connell Street at 6.15pm, you may give evidence that you saw the accused walking down O'Connell Street at 6pm
Mar shampla, i gcás ionsaithe nuair a tharla an choir ar Shráid Uí Chonaill ag 6.16i.n. is féidir leat fianaise a thabhairt go bhfaca tú an cúisí ag siúl ar Shráid Uí Chonaill ag 6.i.n
In that situation, you are giving circumstantial evidence to the court
Sa chás sin is fianaise imthoisceach atá dhá thabhairt agat don chúirt

Inferences or conclusions may be drawn from the fact that the accused was on O'Connell Street at 6pm, but you have not given evidence as to the actual fact at issue in the case - whether the accused attacked a person

D'fhéadfaí conclúidí nó tuairimí a bhaint as an bhfíric go raibh an cúisí ar Shráid Uí Chonaill ag 6i.n. ach níl fianaise tugtha agat maidir leis an bhfíric atá i gceist sa chás - ar ionsaigh an cúisí duine
In a case of a theft, examples of circumstantial evidence include:
Más goid atá i gceist, seo a leanas samplaí de fhianaise imthoisceach:
• Evidence of the defendant's fingerprints at the scene of the crime
• Fianaise go raibh méarloirg an chúisí ar láthair na coire
• The fact that the defendant was found with a large amount of money without being able to give any reason
• Go raibh suim mhór airgid ag an gcúisí nach raibh sé/sí in ann a mhíniú go sásúil
In the case of a murder, examples of circumstantial evidence include:
I gcás dúnmharaithe, seo a leanas samplaí de fhianaise imthoisceach:
• The fact that the accused had an intense dislike of the victim
• Nár thaitin an té a d'fhulaing an choir ró-mhór leis an gcúisí
• The fact that the accused behaved in a bizarre and suspicious way after the offence
• Go raibh iompar an chúisí aisteach agus amhrasach tar éis na coire
• The fact that he or she lied about his or her alibi
• Gur inis an cúisí bréag maidir lena (h)ailibí
• The fact that he or she was in the area at the time that the offence was committed
• Go raibh sé/sí sa cheantar ag an am ar tharla an choir
• The fact that the defendant's blood or DNA corresponds to blood or DNA found on the victim's body
• Gur ionann fuil an chúisí nó DNA agus fuil nó DNA a fuarthas ar chorp an té a dúnmharaíodh
The general rule is that circumstantial evidence is admissible
Mar riail ghinearálta tá fianaise imthoisceach ceadaithe
However, the courts are careful when the only evidence in a case is circumstantial evidence
Ach, bíonn na cúirteanna cúramach nuair nach bhfuil de fhianaise i gcás ach fianaise imthoisceach
Circumstantial evidence must be closely examined and it must be looked at cumulatively
Ní mór scrúdú géar a dhéanamh ar fhianaise imthoisceach agus ní mór breathnú air go carnach

In other words, a court would be very slow to convict a defendant on the basis of one piece of circumstantial evidence alone, for example, the fact that his or her fingerprints were found at the scene of the crime
I bhfocail eile, bheadh leisce ar chúirt cosantóir a chiontú bunaithe ar phíosa amháin fianaise imthoisceach inti féin, mar shampla, go raibh a m(h)éarloirg faighte ag láthair na coire
However, if there are a number of different strands of circumstantial evidence, taken together, they have more weight
Ach, má bhíonn roinnt píosaí éagsúla fianaise imthoisceach ann, tógtha lena chéile, bíonn údarás níos mó acu

For example, in a theft case, if the defendant was seen in the area at the time of the theft, his or her fingerprints were found at the scene of the crime and if he or she was later found with a large sum of money that he or she could not explain, then the court would be more likely to convict the accused

Mar shampla, más goid a bhí ann, má chonacthas an cosantóir sa cheantar ag an am, má bhí a m(h)éarloirg faighte ag láthair na coire agus má bhí suim mhór airgid aige/aici ina dhiaidh sin nach raibh sé/sí in ann a mhíniú, bheadh níos mó seans ann go mbeadh an chúirt sásta an duine sin a chiontú
For more detailed information you should seek legal advice
Ba chóir duit comhairle dlí a lorg chun faisnéis mionsonraithe a fháil
